comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A William Thomas Biedler (1845?-1897) of Baltimore had something to do with Luray Caverns in the 1880s... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luray_Caverns He married Flora Caroline Burracker and they had four children: wc.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=AHN&db=kg... Seems to be the same guy, because his brother Charles Edward Biedler was in the same company during the war, and lived in Baltimore afterwards: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=48873552 They had a third brother Andrew who was also a Baltimore businessman.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of July 9, 1897 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60917FC395811738... has his obituary and mentions the Mosby regiment and that he joined it at fifteen.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: 1846- July 8, 1897, per the NYT obit.  Born near Luray, VA, so it looks like he was indeed  the Luray Caverns owner.

comment._content: So many young men going to war!
